instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2115: What is 820-2115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message:
board boots to os but image is distorted. 

<RESISTOR>R9665</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R9663</RESISTOR> were knocked off of the board

replaced <RESISTOR>R9663</RESISTOR> before realizing <RESISTOR>R9665</RESISTOR> was knocked off as well and surprisingly it booted with no distortion but a couple minutes after distortion returned.

replaced <RESISTOR>R9665</RESISTOR> twice but it wont go above 5.39kohm it should be at or close to 100ohm

distortion continues.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message: What is a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message: My bad its <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message:
Termination resistor <RESISTOR>R9665</RESISTOR> must be 100 Ohm or it will give interference on that LVDS line. Double check what is going on there.

But the board was messed with, so what are the chances it has a bag GPU that was either heated, reballed or replaced with Chinese junk.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R9665</RESISTOR> look fine and has continuity. it is measuring 98.8ohm

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message:
replaced <RESISTOR>R9665</RESISTOR> twice but it wont go above 5.39kohm it should be at or close to 100ohm

You said it measured incorrect.

But the board was messed with, so what are the chances it has a bag GPU that was either heated, reballed or replaced with Chinese junk.

Yes or no?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message:
got them mixed up its <RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR> thats not going above 5.39kohm

but yes the board has most likely been messed with before.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message:
9665 look fine and has continuity. it is measuring 98.8ohm
got them mixed up its <RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR> thats not going above 5.39kohm

What is it now?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message:
so let me correct myself

<RESISTOR>R9663</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR> were knocked off. replaced <RESISTOR>R9663</RESISTOR> before realizing <RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR> was missing. booted and got a good image but after a couple minutes went back to distortion.

replaced <RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR> twice because it wont go above 5.39kohm but should be 100ohm or 1% within it.

<RESISTOR>R9663</RESISTOR>=98.8ohm
<RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR>=5.39kohm

image is still distorted.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR> should also be 100 Ohm, so with a good resistor on there it should read 100 Ohm. Why you say "wont go above 5.39kohm" is a mystery to me as it needs to be lower not higher.

But I hope you realize that in the end when you fixed this issue and this board still has its original 2011 GPU it will be a matter of time before that dies. Unless you intend to replace the GPU this board can never be considered reliable in any way. With a new GPU they are good for about 2-3 years and it WILL die again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message: oh yeah kohm is more than an ohm ha. ill see what happens if i can get a good resistor on there. then move on if it doesnt fix it. thanks duke.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> image distortion
threads.message: Problem solved image back to normal after replacing <RESISTOR>R9655</RESISTOR>.
